answers.description: A programming language is used to implement algorithms.

answers.text: A set of rules to solve a problem
answers.description: An algorithm is a step-by-step procedure or formula for solving a problem.
A data storage unit is where data is stored, not a set of rules.
A security protocol is related to securing data or access, not solving general problems.
Security measures protect data but are not data structures.

answers.text: A way to organize and store data
answers.description: Data structures are specialized formats for organizing and storing data on a computer.
Algorithms may use data structures, but they are not data structures themselves.
Resource management tools manage resources but are not data structures.
A sorting algorithm is a type of algorithm, not encapsulation.
A data structure is a way to organize data, not encapsulation.

answers.text: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data
answers.description: Encapsulation is an object-oriented programming concept where data and methods that operate on that data are bundled together.
A security vulnerability is a flaw or weakness, not encapsulation.

questions.text: What is resource management in computer science?

answers.description: Managing human resources is not related to computer science.

answers.text: Efficient use of system resources like memory and CPU
answers.description: Resource management in computer science refers to the efficient allocation and deallocation of system resources.
Data encryption is related to security, not resource management.
Data storage is a part of resource management but not the complete definition.

questions.text: What is the primary goal of computer security?

answers.description: Speeding up system performance is not the primary goal of security.

answers.text: Protect against unauthorized access and data loss
answers.description: The primary goal of computer security is to protect systems and data from unauthorized access, data loss, and other threats.
Data analysis is not related to security.
Data storage is a part of resource management, not security.

questions.text: What is a stack in data structures?

answers.description: A queue with priority is known as a priority queue, not a stack.

answers.text: A linear data structure that follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle
answers.description: A stack is a linear data structure where elements are added and removed following the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle.
A tree structure is a hierarchical data structure, not a stack.
A security protocol is not a data structure.

questions.text: What is a binary search algorithm?

answers.text: An algorithm that searches by dividing the sorted array into two halves
answers.description: A binary search algorithm searches for an element in a sorted array by repeatedly dividing the array into two halves and comparing the middle element.

answers.text: An algorithm that searches each element one by one
answers.description: Searching each element one by one is a linear search, not binary search.

answers.text: An algorithm that sorts an array
answers.description: Sorting an array is not searching.
Encrypting data is related to security, not searching.
A tree is a hierarchical data structure, not a linked list.

answers.text: A linear data structure where elements are stored in nodes
answers.description: A linked list is a linear data structure where elements are stored in nodes, and each node points to the next node in the sequence.
A security measure is not a data structure.
A sorting algorithm is not a data structure.

questions.text: What is Big O notation used for?

answers.text: Measuring the efficiency of an algorithm
answers.description: Big O notation is used to describe the performance or complexity of an algorithm, specifically in terms of time or space.
Encrypting data is related to security, not algorithm efficiency.
Storing data is related to data structures, not algorithm efficiency.
Managing resources is not the purpose of Big O notation.
A sorting algorithm is not a data structure.

answers.text: A data structure that stores key-value pairs
answers.description: A hash table is a data structure used to store key-value pairs. It uses a hash function to compute an index into an array of buckets or slots.
A security protocol is not a data structure.
A resource management tool is not a data structure.

answers.text: A way to write self-modifying code
answers.description: Self-modifying code is not dynamic programming.

answers.text: A technique to solve problems by breaking them into smaller subproblems
answers.description: Dynamic programming is a method for solving complex problems by breaking them down into simpler subproblems and solving each subproblem only once, saving its answer in a table.
Concurrent programming is about parallel execution, not dynamic programming.
Secure coding is about writing code that is secure, not about solving problems efficiently.
A heap is a different type of data structure.
A red-black tree is a type of self-balancing binary search tree where each node contains an extra bit for denoting the color of the node, either red or black.
A linked list is a linear data structure, not a tree.
A security protocol is not a data structure.

questions.text: What is a deadlock in computer science?

answers.text: A situation where a set of processes are blocked because each process is holding a resource and waiting for another resource acquired by some other process
answers.description: A deadlock is a state in computer science where a set of processes are unable to proceed because each is waiting for one of the others to release a resource.

answers.text: An error in a program that causes it to crash unexpectedly
answers.description: An error that causes a program to crash is not specifically referred to as a deadlock.

answers.text: A security breach in a computer system
answers.description: A security breach is an incident that results in unauthorized access to computer data, applications, networks, or devices. It is not related to the concept of a deadlock.

answers.text: The process of optimizing code to improve performance
answers.description: Code optimization is the process of modifying a software system to make some aspect of it work more efficiently or use fewer resources. It is not related to deadlocks.

questions.text: What is the time complexity of quicksort in the worst-case scenario?

answers.description: O(n) is linear time complexity, not applicable to quicksort's worst-case.
O(n log n) is the average-case time complexity for quicksort.
The time complexity of quicksort in the worst-case scenario is O(n^2), although its average-case time complexity is generally much better.
O(1) is constant time, not applicable to quicksort.
A data structure is not a security vulnerability.
A sorting algorithm is not a security vulnerability.

answers.text: A security vulnerability where a program writes data outside the allocated memory
answers.description: A buffer overflow is a security vulnerability that occurs when a program writes data to a buffer and overruns the buffer's boundary, writing adjacent memory.
A resource management technique is not a security vulnerability.

questions.text: What is the time complexity of quicksort in the worst-case scenario?

answers.description: O(n) is linear time complexity, not applicable to quicksort's worst-case.
O(n log n) is the average-case time complexity for quicksort.
The time complexity of quicksort in the worst-case scenario is O(n^2), although its average-case time complexity is generally much better.
O(1) is constant time, not applicable to quicksort.
A data structure is not a security vulnerability.
A sorting algorithm is not a security vulnerability.

answers.text: A security vulnerability where a program writes data outside the allocated memory
answers.description: A buffer overflow is a security vulnerability that occurs when a program writes data to a buffer and overruns the buffer's boundary, writing adjacent memory.
A resource management technique is not a security vulnerability.

questions.text: What is the CAP theorem in distributed computing?

answers.text: It states that it's impossible for a distributed system to simultaneously provide consistency, availability, and partition tolerance
answers.description: The CAP theorem states that in any distributed computing system, it is impossible to simultaneously provide all three of the following guarantees: Consistency, Availability, and Partition tolerance.

answers.text: It states that a system can only be secure or fast, but not both
answers.description: The CAP theorem doesn't discuss security or speed.

answers.text: It states that all algorithms can be parallelized
answers.description: Not all algorithms can be parallelized.

answers.text: It states that resource management is the most important aspect of distributed computing
answers.description: Resource management is important but not the focus of the CAP theorem.
A Turing machine is not a real-world computer.

answers.text: A hypothetical machine used to understand the limits of what can be computed
answers.description: A Turing machine is a mathematical model of computation that defines an abstract machine, which manipulates symbols on a strip of tape according to a table of rules.
A supercomputer is a type of real-world computer, not a Turing machine.
A security protocol is not a Turing machine.

answers.text: The study of algorithms that use the least amount of resources
answers.description: The study of efficient algorithms is algorithm analysis, not computational complexity theory.

answers.text: The study of the complexity of different problems in terms of time and space
answers.description: Computational complexity theory is a branch of the theory of computation that focuses on classifying computational problems according to their inherent difficulty.

answers.text: The study of the best ways to secure a computer system
answers.description: Security is not the focus of computational complexity theory.

answers.text: The study of resource management in distributed systems
answers.description: Resource management in distributed systems is not the focus of computational complexity theory.

answers.text: A vulnerability that has been patched
answers.description: A patched vulnerability is not a zero-day.

answers.text: A vulnerability that is known to the public but not yet fixed
answers.description: A known vulnerability is not a zero-day if it's known to the public.

answers.text: A vulnerability that is unknown to the public and has not been fixed
answers.description: A zero-day vulnerability is a security flaw that is unknown to the vendor and the public, making it particularly dangerous because there is no fix available at the time of discovery.

answers.text: A vulnerability that has no impact on the system
answers.description: A vulnerability with no impact is not a zero-day.

questions.text: What is the P vs NP problem?

answers.text: A problem related to network protocols
answers.description: The P vs NP problem is not related to network protocols.

answers.text: A problem that questions whether every problem whose solution can be verified quickly can also be solved quickly
answers.description: The P vs NP problem is a major unsolved problem in computer science that asks whether every problem whose solution can be quickly verified can also be solved quickly.

answers.text: A problem related to resource management
answers.description: The P vs NP problem is not related to resource management.

answers.text: A problem related to data encryption
answers.description: The P vs NP problem is not related to data encryption.
